intro: Antennaria aprica var. minuscula, commonly known as the dwarf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky and sandy soils of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with slender, ascending stems and tiny, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in alpine or coastal environments. Its delicate appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
